bibl.title: Letter from T.H.D. Griffitts to Henry Rose Carter, March 12, 1913

div1.p: Griffitts writes to Carter about his anti-malaria work. He describes the problems with ponds and prospective mosquito breeding experiments.

div1.head: Letter from T.H.D. Griffitts to Henry Rose Carter, March 12, 1913
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
N. M. C.
Griff
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
519 Dexter Avenue,
Montgomery, Alabama,
March 12, 1913.
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
The more I see of malaria conditions, the more I think that
“p-o-n-d” spells “malaria”, and that “problem” in impounded waters
is spelled “flotage”. If a swamp is important it is a ponded
swamp--there must be depth to the water (and Anopheline condi-
tions enhanced by “openness”). Malarially, then, why not three
classifications of swamps: Ponded swamps, Wet swamps, Stream swamps?
Character of water would, or might, further divide the ponded swamp
into quad. and crucians types.

However, speaking of flotage, I spent some time in Talladega
county last week-- near Lincoln in the Northern part of the county
at the Jackson shoals pond (1912) where there is much malaria. This
is a small pond made the same year as Lock 12. It is claimed there
is little malaria now about Talladega Springs, though. I noticed
from the train, especially about the station at the mouth of
Peckerwood Creek, an enormous amount of drift in the water. Whether
this holds much flotage of the “organized type” I could not say.
Grossly the thing looks like malaria should not have practically
disappeared from that section. If I have opportunity, I want to
make house catches in the same places we did in '15 and "16 to
see whether quads, have disappeared in proportion to the dis-
appearance of malaria.

I shall try to work out something on your minimum, or
hoof-print, breeding of quads. I have no help. You know the dif-
ficulties. Gage will be with me for the next two or three weeks,
and will then go independently, or with Mayne, I understand,
to N.C. How much better would it have been to have coordinated
the work and considered experience worth something!

I shall let you know what I see and waht I am doing.
Please give me the benefit of your suggestions and advice when
you have time, wont you?
